entry.et: Middle English, from Old English beorht; akin to Old High German beraht bright, Sanskrit bhrājate it shines

def.dt: :radiating or reflecting light :shining sparkling bright lights bright eyes
:radiant with happiness bright smiling faces bright moments
:illustrious glorious brightest star of the opera
:of high saturation or lightness bright colors
:lively cheerful be bright and jovial among your guests Shakespeare
:intelligent clever a bright idea bright children
:auspicious promising bright prospects for the future

entry.pt: bright brilliant radiant luminous lustrous mean shining or glowing with light. bright implies emitting or reflecting a high degree of light. brilliant implies intense often sparkling brightness. radiant stresses the emission or seeming emission of rays of light. luminous implies emission of steady, suffused, glowing light by reflection or in surrounding darkness. lustrous stresses an even, rich light from a surface that reflects brightly without sparkling or glittering.

def.dt: :a bright color usually used in plural rich earth tones and crisp brights Patricia Peterson
:providing an unambiguous criterion or guideline especially in law a bright–line distinction
:any of several kidney diseases marked especially by albumin in the urine
